Sequence Information.Peptide Name: mBD-1 (Murine beta-defensin 1, natural AMPs; UCSS1a;  mouse, rodents, mammals, animals; 3S=S)
Sequence Information.Source: kidney, tongue, esophagus, and trachea, Mouse,Mus musculus

Literature Information.Literature: Host expression:  The gene is mapped to chromosome 8 (see ref).Sequence analysis: A murine homolog of hBD-1 (Morrison et al., 1998).Activity: Active against both Gram-positive and negative bacteria P. aeruginosa (MIC 50 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness:  It's activity is NaCl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa  (Bals R et al, 1998;Morrison GM et al, 1998).Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: Recombinantly expressed peptide (140 mg/L) also displayed antifungal activity against C. albicans and C. neoformans (Wang Y et al. 2010 Appl Biochem Biotechnol 160: 213-232). A fusion construction of mBD-1 and mBD-3 is active against Influenza A Virus (IAV) (Li W et al, 2014).  Updated 5/2010; 3/2014; 11/2023  GW.
Literature Information.Author: Huttner KM1, Kozak CA, Bevins CL.1997
Literature Information.Title: The mouse genome encodes a single homolog of the antimicrobial peptide human beta-defensin 1.
